overview.quote: Pre-validation is key, but stealing like an artist requires skill.
overview.introText: Master the art of transforming any content type—short-form videos, YouTube content, articles, or LinkedIn posts—into engaging platform-native content that retains impact while feeling authentic to you.

keyTerms.definition: Adapting existing content for new platforms while preserving core value and adjusting to platform psychology.
Using others' content as a starting point without plagiarizing, focusing on adding your unique perspective and value.
How audience expectations differ across platforms, requiring specific adaptations in tone, visual style and delivery.
Maintaining what made the original content attention-grabbing while adapting it to your style and platform requirements.
Leveraging content that's already proven successful to increase the likelihood your adaptation will perform well.

actionPlan: Identify high-performing content in your niche
Analyze what makes it engaging (hook, structure, etc.)
Strip corporate language if from LinkedIn/articles
Rewrite in your natural speaking voice
Adjust visuals to match platform expectations

mainContent.title: Universal Repurposing Principles
mainContent.text: Regardless of source material, focus on preserving the core hook while making the content undeniably yours through voice, perspective, and visual style. Success lies in balancing what worked originally with your unique contribution.

summaryPoints: Honor what made the original work
Add your unique perspective and experience
Make it impossible to confuse with the original

mainContent.title: Source-Specific Strategies
mainContent.text: Each content type requires specific adaptation techniques: short-form needs hook preservation, YouTube needs thumbnail-to-hook translation, articles need journalistic detox, and LinkedIn needs corporate deprogramming.

summaryPoints: YouTube: Use thumbnail/title as your hook
LinkedIn: Add personality the original lacked

mainContent.title: The Memory Method
mainContent.text: For any long-form content, let your memory act as the first filter. Consume the content, then write what naturally stayed with you—these elements are most likely to resonate with viewers and form the foundation of your adaptation.

summaryPoints: Watch/read the content without notes first
Write down what you remember afterward
Focus on points that sparked emotion in you
Trust your memory to filter the fluff

mainContent.title: Platform Transformation
mainContent.text: Content must feel native to its platform. LinkedIn polish becomes TikTok authenticity, article formality becomes conversational energy, and YouTube structured explanations become quick, hook-driven revelations.

summaryPoints: Match the energy expectations of the platform
Adjust visual style to platform norms
Transform writing styles into speaking styles

proTips.text: Study comment sections of your inspiration content—they reveal what truly resonated and often contain insights the creator missed.
Avoid AI rewriting tools—they strip personality and can't capture the natural speaking tone essential for short-form success.

finalWords.emphasis: Content Is Never Perfected Until Everyone Has Seen It
finalWords.description: Your adaptation isn't stealing—it's extending the reach of valuable ideas.
